intro: Habranthus millarensis, commonly known as the Millarensis bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Brazil. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet petals. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest understories. Its bulbs are underground storage organs that support its growth cycle. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
